thread.title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts

title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts
text: > Entertainment Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts Sixty-eight-year-old Florinda Ruiz Carapia, better known as "Hermana Flor," poses for a photo in the kitchen of her convent, the Pontifical Palafoxiano Seminary, in Puebla, Mexico, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. Hermana Flor has become one of the five finalists on Mexicoâ€™s version of Master Chef, a "reality" program broadcast by TV Azteca in which amateur chefs compete for a one-million peso ($59,000) prize. (AP Photo/Eduardo Verdugo)
